title: Animals without backbones
brief_description: What kinds of structures do these animals have? How do such bodies move about? How are their bodies supported? Nature photography points out the characteristics of the anthropods, spiny-skinned animals, molluscs, sponges, bag-like animals, and earthworms, and shows these animals carrying out some of their life functions.
